title: [IT人入] 有無人有興趣討論下sql, no-sql 同埋 new-sql

replies.msg:
原文鏈結:“Why SQL is beating NoSQL, and what this means for the future of data” @acoustik https://blog.timescale.com/why-sql-beating-nosql-what-this-means-for-future-of-data-time-series-database-348b777b847a

After years of being left for dead, SQL today is making a comeback.

1. SQL嘅誕生

大約喺1970年代，IBM嘅研究當中，兩位年輕嘅phd畢業生 Donald Chamberlin and Raymond Boyce，整左一種全新又易用嘅query language(亦即sql), 目標係想令無受過電腦訓練嘅人都識用。

佢地意識到: much of the success of the computer industry depends on developing a class of users other than trained computer specialists.

後來，sql席卷全球，System R, Ingres, DB2, Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MySQL 等相繼出現。而sql亦都成為左database嘅國際語言。


2. NoSQL取代SQL

原本sql一直處於領導地位，但直至Internet出現，改變左呢個現象。Internet令到data嘅數量增大左好多好多倍(users嘅數量由local變做global), 但係大家發現sql開始無能力承載咁多data, 出現左overload嘅情況。

之後，no-sql就變成左新嘅寵兒:
Two new Internet giants made breakthroughs, and developed their own distributed non-relational systems to help with this new onslaught of data: MapReduce (published 2004) and Bigtable (published 2006) by Google, and Dynamo (published 2007) by Amazon. These seminal papers led to even more non-relational databases, including Hadoop (based on the MapReduce paper, 2006), Cassandra (heavily inspired by both the Bigtable and Dynamo papers, 2008) and MongoDB (2009). Because these were new systems largely written from scratch, they also eschewed SQL, leading to the rise of the NoSQL movement.

但係no-sql有幾個問題: 1) 要學多好多新嘅 languages; 2) databases 同 applications之間嘅連繫變得複雜好多, 需要寫好多唔穩陣嘅 glue code; 3) 無第3方開發嘅軟件， 公司需要開發自己嘅operational同visualization tools.

3. SQL嘅回歸

// Initially seduced by the dark side, the software community began to see the light and come back to SQL.

Then came the rise of NewSQL: new scalable databases that fully embraced SQL.//


其中一個例子就係Google 佢地發現 lack of sql有嚴重嘅問題:
“While these systems provided some of the benefits of a database system, they lacked many traditional database features that application developers often rely on. A key example is a robust query language, meaning that developers had to write complex code to process and aggregate the data in their applications. As a result, we decided to turn Spanner into a full featured SQL system, with query execution tightly integrated with the other architectural features of Spanner (such as strong consistency and global replication).”

佢地鼓吹將nosql結合sql 形成new sql :
While NoSQL methods provided a simple path to launching Spanner, and continue to be useful in simple retrieval scenarios, SQL has provided significant additional value in expressing more complex data access patterns and pushing computation to the data.


長話短說: 作者覺得正如IP係networking嘅universal interface, sql 亦都會喺不久嘅將來成為各種data嘅universal interface:






大家有咩睇法
new-sql嘅優勢係咪真係咁顯著 其實我覺得如果唔係好似Google咁需要對咁多唔同地方嘅users同customers 需要有個robust嘅database嘅話 其實比較isolated嘅industry真係無呢個initiative去改自己現成嘅database 反正來來去去都係幾個固定客戶 幾個固定supplier 自己都已有晒熟悉嘅specifications同guidelines去處理資料 好難有動機去改變

我覺得係schema-less 無乜實際用途以致大家都係傾向用返er paradigm

一般webapp真係crud已經夠用
我覺得最後都係變成咁

根本問題係大家唔知道自己想要啲咩 淨係拎sql同nosql做buzz word
其實搞清楚自己既use case 再睇返啲tool比到咩你 就知要揀咩
跟潮流揀=on9

例子1
你要整虛擬炒股平台 要同時加減兩個戶口既野
咁就可以用sql既transaction
唔係話nosql無 但係nosql既產品五花八門 邊啲有transaction邊啲無 又要浪費時間搵 又無sql經歷咁多時間考驗 多數係sql類產品相對robust啲
留意返schema/schemaless係呢個case係唔關事既 因為反正你都係用戶口id去做key

例子2
你要整個hamming distance rNN query index
咁個backing既data structure就係要最最簡單既key-value store
唔駛要transaction/schema 亦唔駛咩鳩document
總之就係要persistent又compact又快既key value store

以上既例子 你跟潮流揀啲主流nosql 都會唔optimal 甚至有悲劇既performance issue

而係sql類產品既full text search太廢
結果要flatten晒做document放落某個nosql入面

replies.msg:
Performance悲劇
當你有十位數咁多個document 每個document既text由幾十到一千不等
你會想用relationship database以外既野
例如solr/elasticsearch

應該話xml類似html 都係ml

我之前做既都係所謂big data同data mining
我可以保證同以前既database technology無分別
我地自己都唔覺做緊咩big data 係老闆中意咁講

Machine learning又係 明明好多野做基本clustering就得
係都要有理無理用個NN

唔熟web 之前未聽過 係咪姐係要整個database app咁
https://www.promptcloud.com/blog/Building-Database-Apps-via-Web-Crawling

好似可以用python整 練下自己啲python都好 聽老細講就黎變世界第一多人用嘅programming language
“Develop your first web crawler in Python Scrapy” @kadnan https://medium.com/python-pandemonium/develop-your-first-web-crawler-in-python-scrapy-6b2ee4baf954


btw 之前有同事同我講叫我有時間學下GO 話係一隻值得一學嘅語言 巴打點睇
